sentences.sContent: ‘Where’s your office?’ ‘It’s on the third floor.’
I love the spring – it’s a wonderful time of the year.
sentences.sCn: 我喜欢春季——这是一年里最美妙的时节。

sentences.sContent: There were people crying, buildings on fire. It was terrible!
sentences.sCn: 有人在哭喊，楼房在燃烧―太可怕了！

sentences.sContent: Don’t blame me. It wasn’t my idea.
sentences.sCn: 不要责备我，这不是我的主意。

sentences.sContent: This little beast is a lemur and it lives in Madagascar.
sentences.sCn: 这小动物是狐猴，生活在马达加斯加。

sentences.sContent: ...Many experts feel it is the wisest to walk up hill...
...I would like to sell it for two hundred Yuan...
...Some team members find it hard to agree on questions like membership and the team’s purpose...
...Viewing the past in high definition can make it very difficult to get over pain and regret...
...which makes it reliable and flexible to ride...
...So it might be a good idea to get someone else to drive you home after that marathon...
...While it may sound like an advantage to many...
...we have choices about how we respond to it when it comes...
...If it is hard enough to define a team’s membership...
...And he can load them onto the shuttle for you when it arrives...

phrases.pCn: 可以说是，似乎就是；好像

trans.tranOther: used to refer to a thing, animal, situation, idea etc that has already been mentioned or is already known about
